alert.note: Alert for Hart (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:25PM EST until January 03 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Green River at Munfordville affecting Hart County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Green River at Munfordville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water enters city park under US 31W bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 31.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.9 feet tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.5 feet on 02/06/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.
